actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select features and target
features = ['LotArea', 'GrLivArea', 'GarageArea']
X_train = train_data[features]
y_train = train_data['SalePrice']

# Handle missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.mean(), inplace=True)

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on test data
X_test = test_data[features].fillna(test_data.mean())
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select features and target
features = ['LotArea', 'GrLivArea', 'GarageArea']
X_train = train_data[features].apply(pd.to_numeric, errors='coerce')
y_train = train_data['SalePrice'].astype(float)

# Handle missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on test data
X_test = test_data[features].apply(pd.to_numeric, errors='coerce').fillna(test_data.median())
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

It appears there might have been an issue with the validation command. Let's try running the script one more time and then manually check the output for any obvious issues. If the script runs successfully, you should see the generated `submission.csv` file. You can then manually inspect the file or submit it if required.

from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select features and target

X_train = train_data[features].apply(pd.to_numeric, errors='coerce')
y_train = train_data['SalePrice'].astype(float)

# Handle missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)

X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_data = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_data = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Select features and target
features = ['LotArea', 'GrLivArea', 'GarageArea']
X_train = train_data[features].apply(pd.to_numeric, errors='coerce')
y_train = train_data['SalePrice'].astype(float)

# Handle missing values
X_train.fillna(X_train.median(), inplace=True)

# Scale features
scaler = StandardScaler()
X_scaled = scaler.fit_transform(X_train)

# Train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_scaled, y_train)

# Predict on test data
X_test = test_data[features].apply(pd.to_numeric, errors='coerce').fillna(test_data.median())
X_test_scaled = scaler.transform(X_test)
predictions = model.predict(X_test_scaled)

# Save submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_data['Id'], 'SalePrice': predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
